author: Staff Reporter
text:
Leaking gas comes into contact with sparks from switch board where a charger was kept plugged

In a fire accident caused by a gas leak, two members of a family in B.V. Nagar, Vyasarpadi, died on Monday morning.

Police sources identified the deceased as M. Rajendran, 57, who was employed as a security guard, and his wife Rani, 49, a homemaker. The couple’s son, Dinesh, sustained severe burns.

Cylinder not turned off

The investigating policemen said the leaking gas came into contact with sparks from a switch board where a cell phone charger had been kept plugged, which resulted in a fire. The cylinder had not been turned off on Sunday night, they said.

The fire spread quickly and engulfed the house. Noticing smoke billowing from the house, neighbours called the fire control room and also informed the M.K.B. Nagar police station.

Fire and Rescue Services personnel and police managed to break into the house.

The three persons, who had lost consciousness, were moved to a hospital nearby. While Rajendran died soon after he was shifted to the hospital, Rani succumbed to her injuries later in the evening. Dinesh continues to receive treatment, police said.

Similar incident

Only on January 18, three men were injured in Villivakkam following a similar accident caused by gas leakage.

Nagaraj, along with his friends Srinivasan and Babu, sustained burns after he failed to turn off the gas supply in his house at Barathi Nagar 2nd Street, Villivakkam. The next morning, when Nagaraj switched on the light, the gas-filled room was engulfed in a fire, leaving the three persons seriously injured.

Their son, Dinesh, sustains severe burns and is undergoing treatment
title: Couple dies in fire due to gas leak
